dict.string: The length of time that a note is sounded. It can be whole, half, quarter, eighth, sixteenth.
The number of periods or regularly occurring events of any given kind in unit of time, usually in one second. The note A which is above Middle C has a frequency of 440 Hz. It's called A4
The rate of speed of a musical passage or work. Usually indicated by such terms as adagio, allegro, etc., or by reference to the metronome.
A block of repeated code that runs a certain number of times.
A tone of a certain pitch, or a sign or character used to represent it in a piece of music.
A sign placed before a note indicating a chromatic alteration of its pitch.
A piece of music with the vocal and instrumental parts arranged on lines.
